cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest today, then turning west and west-northwest Friday; forecast to bend northwest toward the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near/just west of Morgan City

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, Louisiana
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast of Louisiana and adjacent Mississippi Delta region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible, 49 % chance of 34-kt winds with peak onset probability 22 % late Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (port is inland; surge effects limited to lower Mississippi River south of the port).
weather_observation.rainfall: 6â€“12 inches of rain possible with isolated amounts up to 18 inches, leading to flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential Mississippi River flooding and interruptions to inland barge traffic due to prolonged heavy rainfall upriver.
